revised_title: Invisible Radiation of Electric Light and Calorescence
tldr: The author, John Tyndall, investigates the invisible radiation of electric light and discovers that the heat distribution in the electric spectrum is different from that of sunlight. He also introduces the term 'calorescence' to describe the phenomena of heating and incandescence caused by invisible rays. Tyndall demonstrates various experiments using the invisible radiation, such as igniting different materials and creating incandescent images.
